content.raw:
Yeah, I have mixed feelings about effectively having it twice in the build process. It wouldn't be inherently wrong; it would just add to the time required for building, because it would get built and installed for each ignition dependency plus the project that's being tested, even though it's only really needed once at the start.

I would suggest that we generally leave it out for projects that depend on an ignition project that already use a suitable branch of `ign-cmake`. If we have a weird situation where we want to test the current project against a specific branch of `ign-cmake` which isn't needed by the ignition projects that it depends on, then we can add it explicitly into `configure.bat`, but it needs to come after all the other ignition dependencies are configured, built, and installed.
